34/* Bytecode callback function prototypes */
35
36static void x86_bc_insn_destroy(void *contents);
37static void x86_bc_insn_print(const void *contents, FILE *f,
38 int indent_level);
39static int x86_bc_insn_calc_len(yasm_bytecode *bc,
40 yasm_bc_add_span_func add_span,
41 void *add_span_data);
42static int x86_bc_insn_expand(yasm_bytecode *bc, int span, long old_val,
43 long new_val, /*@out@*/ long *neg_thres,
44 /*@out@*/ long *pos_thres);
45static int x86_bc_insn_tobytes(yasm_bytecode *bc, unsigned char **bufp,
46 unsigned char *bufstart,
47 void *d, yasm_output_value_func output_value,
48 /*@null@*/ yasm_output_reloc_func output_reloc);
49

51static void x86_bc_jmp_print(const void *contents, FILE *f, int indent_level);
52static int x86_bc_jmp_calc_len(yasm_bytecode *bc,
53 yasm_bc_add_span_func add_span,
54 void *add_span_data);
55static int x86_bc_jmp_expand(yasm_bytecode *bc, int span, long old_val,
56 long new_val, /*@out@*/ long *neg_thres,
57 /*@out@*/ long *pos_thres);
58static int x86_bc_jmp_tobytes(yasm_bytecode *bc, unsigned char **bufp,
59 unsigned char *bufstart,
60 void *d, yasm_output_value_func output_value,
61 /*@null@*/ yasm_output_reloc_func output_reloc);
62
63static void x86_bc_jmpfar_destroy(void *contents);
64static void x86_bc_jmpfar_print(const void *contents, FILE *f,
65 int indent_level);
66static int x86_bc_jmpfar_calc_len(yasm_bytecode *bc,
67 yasm_bc_add_span_func add_span,
68 void *add_span_data);
69static int x86_bc_jmpfar_tobytes
70 (yasm_bytecode *bc, unsigned char **bufp, unsigned char *bufstart, void *d,
71 yasm_output_value_func output_value,
72 /*@null@*/ yasm_output_reloc_func output_reloc);

74/* Bytecode callback structures */
75
76static const yasm_bytecode_callback x86_bc_callback_insn = {
77 x86_bc_insn_destroy,
78 x86_bc_insn_print,
79 yasm_bc_finalize_common,
80 NULL,
81 x86_bc_insn_calc_len,
82 x86_bc_insn_expand,
83 x86_bc_insn_tobytes,
84 0
85};
86
87static const yasm_bytecode_callback x86_bc_callback_jmp = {
88 x86_bc_jmp_destroy,
89 x86_bc_jmp_print,
90 yasm_bc_finalize_common,
91 NULL,
92 x86_bc_jmp_calc_len,
93 x86_bc_jmp_expand,
94 x86_bc_jmp_tobytes,
95 0
96};
97
98static const yasm_bytecode_callback x86_bc_callback_jmpfar = {
99 x86_bc_jmpfar_destroy,
100 x86_bc_jmpfar_print,
101 yasm_bc_finalize_common,
102 NULL,
103 x86_bc_jmpfar_calc_len,
104 yasm_bc_expand_common,
105 x86_bc_jmpfar_tobytes,
106 0
107};
108
109int
110yasm_x86__set_rex_from_reg(unsigned char *rex, unsigned char *low3,
111 uintptr_t reg, unsigned int bits,
112 x86_rex_bit_pos rexbit)
113{
114 *low3 = (unsigned char)(reg&7);
115
116 if (bits == 64) {
117 x86_expritem_reg_size size = (x86_expritem_reg_size)(reg & ~0xFUL);
118
119 if (size == X86_REG8X || (reg & 0xF) >= 8) {
120 /* Check to make sure we can set it */
121 if (*rex == 0xff) {
122 yasm_error_set(YASM_ERROR_TYPE,
123 N_("cannot use A/B/C/DH with instruction needing REX"));
124 return 1;
125 }
126 *rex |= 0x40 | (((reg & 8) >> 3) << rexbit);
127 } else if (size == X86_REG8 && (reg & 7) >= 4) {
128 /* AH/BH/CH/DH, so no REX allowed */
129 if (*rex != 0 && *rex != 0xff) {
130 yasm_error_set(YASM_ERROR_TYPE,
131 N_("cannot use A/B/C/DH with instruction needing REX"));
132 return 1;
133 }
134 *rex = 0xff; /* Flag so we can NEVER set it (see above) */
135 }
136 }
137
138 return 0;
139}
140
141void
142yasm_x86__bc_transform_insn(yasm_bytecode *bc, x86_insn *insn)
143{
144 yasm_bc_transform(bc, &x86_bc_callback_insn, insn);
145}
146
147void
148yasm_x86__bc_transform_jmp(yasm_bytecode *bc, x86_jmp *jmp)
149{
150 yasm_bc_transform(bc, &x86_bc_callback_jmp, jmp);
151}
152
153void
154yasm_x86__bc_transform_jmpfar(yasm_bytecode *bc, x86_jmpfar *jmpfar)
155{
156 yasm_bc_transform(bc, &x86_bc_callback_jmpfar, jmpfar);
157}
158
159void
160yasm_x86__ea_init(x86_effaddr *x86_ea, unsigned int spare,
161 yasm_bytecode *precbc)
162{
163 if (yasm_value_finalize(&x86_ea->ea.disp, precbc))
164 yasm_error_set(YASM_ERROR_TOO_COMPLEX,
165 N_("effective address too complex"));
166 x86_ea->modrm &= 0xC7; /* zero spare/reg bits */
167 x86_ea->modrm |= (spare << 3) & 0x38; /* plug in provided bits */
168}
169
170void
171yasm_x86__ea_set_disponly(x86_effaddr *x86_ea)
172{
173 x86_ea->valid_modrm = 0;
174 x86_ea->need_modrm = 0;
175 x86_ea->valid_sib = 0;
176 x86_ea->need_sib = 0;
177}
178
179static x86_effaddr *
180ea_create(void)
181{
182 x86_effaddr *x86_ea = yasm_xmalloc(sizeof(x86_effaddr));
183
184 yasm_value_initialize(&x86_ea->ea.disp, NULL, 0);
185 x86_ea->ea.need_nonzero_len = 0;
186 x86_ea->ea.need_disp = 0;
187 x86_ea->ea.nosplit = 0;
188 x86_ea->ea.strong = 0;
189 x86_ea->ea.segreg = 0;
190 x86_ea->ea.pc_rel = 0;
191 x86_ea->ea.not_pc_rel = 0;
192 x86_ea->ea.data_len = 0;
193 x86_ea->vsib_mode = 0;
194 x86_ea->modrm = 0;
195 x86_ea->valid_modrm = 0;
196 x86_ea->need_modrm = 0;
197 x86_ea->sib = 0;
198 x86_ea->valid_sib = 0;
199 x86_ea->need_sib = 0;
200
201 return x86_ea;
202}
203
204x86_effaddr *
205yasm_x86__ea_create_reg(x86_effaddr *x86_ea, unsigned long reg,
206 unsigned char *rex, unsigned int bits)
207{
208 unsigned char rm;
209
210 if (yasm_x86__set_rex_from_reg(rex, &rm, reg, bits, X86_REX_B))
211 return NULL;
212
213 if (!x86_ea)
214 x86_ea = ea_create();
215 x86_ea->modrm = 0xC0 | rm; /* Mod=11, R/M=Reg, Reg=0 */
216 x86_ea->valid_modrm = 1;
217 x86_ea->need_modrm = 1;
218
219 return x86_ea;
220}
221
222yasm_effaddr *
223yasm_x86__ea_create_expr(yasm_arch *arch, yasm_expr *e)
224{
225 yasm_arch_x86 *arch_x86 = (yasm_arch_x86 *)arch;
226 x86_effaddr *x86_ea;
227
228 x86_ea = ea_create();
229
230 if (arch_x86->parser == X86_PARSER_GAS) {
231 /* Need to change foo+rip into foo wrt rip (even in .intel_syntax mode).
232 * Note this assumes a particular ordering coming from the parser
233 * to work (it's not very smart)!
234 */
235 if (e->op == YASM_EXPR_ADD && e->terms[0].type == YASM_EXPR_REG
236 && e->terms[0].data.reg == X86_RIP) {
237 /* replace register with 0 */
238 e->terms[0].type = YASM_EXPR_INT;
239 e->terms[0].data.intn = yasm_intnum_create_uint(0);
240 /* build new wrt expression */
241 e = yasm_expr_create(YASM_EXPR_WRT, yasm_expr_expr(e),
242 yasm_expr_reg(X86_RIP), e->line);
243 }
244 }
245 yasm_value_initialize(&x86_ea->ea.disp, e, 0);
246 x86_ea->ea.need_disp = 1;
247 x86_ea->need_modrm = 1;
248 /* We won't know whether we need an SIB until we know more about expr and
249 * the BITS/address override setting.
250 */
251 x86_ea->need_sib = 0xff;
252
253 x86_ea->ea.data_len = 0;
254
255 return (yasm_effaddr *)x86_ea;
256}
257
258/*@-compmempass@*/
259x86_effaddr *
260yasm_x86__ea_create_imm(x86_effaddr *x86_ea, yasm_expr *imm,
261 unsigned int im_len)
262{
263 if (!x86_ea)
264 x86_ea = ea_create();
265 yasm_value_initialize(&x86_ea->ea.disp, imm, im_len);
266 x86_ea->ea.need_disp = 1;
267
268 return x86_ea;
269}
270/*@=compmempass@*/
271
272void
273yasm_x86__bc_apply_prefixes(x86_common *common, unsigned char *rex,
274 unsigned int def_opersize_64,
275 unsigned int num_prefixes, uintptr_t *prefixes)
276{
277 unsigned int i;
278 int first = 1;
279
280 for (i=0; i<num_prefixes; i++) {
281 switch ((x86_parse_insn_prefix)(prefixes[i] & 0xff00)) {
282 /*To be accurate, we should enforce that TSX hints come only with a
283 predefined set of instructions, and in most cases only with F0
284 prefix. Otherwise they will have completely different semantics.
285 But F0 prefix can come only with a predefined set of instructions
286 too. And if it comes with other instructions, CPU will #UD.
287 Hence, F0-applicability should be enforced too. But it's not
288 currently. Maybe it is the decision made, that user should know
289 himself what he is doing with LOCK prefix. In this case, we should
290 not enforce TSX hints applicability too. And let user take care of
291 correct usage of TSX hints.
292 That is what we are going to do.*/
293 case X86_ACQREL:
294 if (common->acqrel_pre != 0)
295 yasm_warn_set(YASM_WARN_GENERAL,
296 N_("multiple XACQUIRE/XRELEASE prefixes, "
297 "using leftmost"));
298 common->acqrel_pre = (unsigned char)prefixes[i] & 0xff;
299 break;
300 case X86_LOCKREP:
301 if (common->lockrep_pre != 0)
302 yasm_warn_set(YASM_WARN_GENERAL,
303 N_("multiple LOCK or REP prefixes, using leftmost"));
304 common->lockrep_pre = (unsigned char)prefixes[i] & 0xff;
305 break;
306 case X86_ADDRSIZE:
307 common->addrsize = (unsigned char)prefixes[i] & 0xff;
308 break;
309 case X86_OPERSIZE:
310 common->opersize = (unsigned char)prefixes[i] & 0xff;
311 if (common->mode_bits == 64 && common->opersize == 64 &&
312 def_opersize_64 != 64) {
313 if (!rex)
314 yasm_warn_set(YASM_WARN_GENERAL,
315 N_("ignoring REX prefix on jump"));
316 else if (*rex == 0xff)
317 yasm_warn_set(YASM_WARN_GENERAL,
318 N_("REX prefix not allowed on this instruction, ignoring"));
319 else
320 *rex = 0x48;
321 }
322 break;
323 case X86_SEGREG:
324 /* This is a hack.. we should really be putting this in the
325 * the effective address!
326 */
327 common->lockrep_pre = (unsigned char)prefixes[i] & 0xff;
328 break;
329 case X86_REX:
330 if (!rex)
331 yasm_warn_set(YASM_WARN_GENERAL,
332 N_("ignoring REX prefix on jump"));
333 else if (*rex == 0xff)
334 yasm_warn_set(YASM_WARN_GENERAL,
335 N_("REX prefix not allowed on this instruction, ignoring"));
336 else {
337 if (*rex != 0) {
338 if (first)
339 yasm_warn_set(YASM_WARN_GENERAL,
340 N_("overriding generated REX prefix"));
341 else
342 yasm_warn_set(YASM_WARN_GENERAL,
343 N_("multiple REX prefixes, using leftmost"));
344 }
345 /* Here we assume that we can't get this prefix in non
346 * 64 bit mode due to checks in parse_check_prefix().
347 */
348 common->mode_bits = 64;
349 *rex = (unsigned char)prefixes[i] & 0xff;
350 }
351 first = 0;
352 break;
353 }
354 }
355}
356
357static void
358x86_bc_insn_destroy(void *contents)
359{
360 x86_insn *insn = (x86_insn *)contents;
361 if (insn->x86_ea)
362 yasm_x86__ea_destroy((yasm_effaddr *)insn->x86_ea);
363 if (insn->imm) {
364 yasm_value_delete(insn->imm);
365 yasm_xfree(insn->imm);
366 }
367 yasm_xfree(contents);
368}
369
370static void
371x86_bc_jmp_destroy(void *contents)
372{
373 x86_jmp *jmp = (x86_jmp *)contents;
374 yasm_value_delete(&jmp->target);
375 yasm_xfree(contents);
376}
377
378static void
379x86_bc_jmpfar_destroy(void *contents)
380{
381 x86_jmpfar *jmpfar = (x86_jmpfar *)contents;
382 yasm_value_delete(&jmpfar->segment);
383 yasm_value_delete(&jmpfar->offset);
384 yasm_xfree(contents);
385}
386
387void
388yasm_x86__ea_destroy(yasm_effaddr *ea)
389{
390 yasm_value_delete(&ea->disp);
391 yasm_xfree(ea);
392}
393
394void
395yasm_x86__ea_print(const yasm_effaddr *ea, FILE *f, int indent_level)
396{
397 const x86_effaddr *x86_ea = (const x86_effaddr *)ea;
398 fprintf(f, "%*sDisp:\n", indent_level, "");
399 yasm_value_print(&ea->disp, f, indent_level+1);
400 fprintf(f, "%*sNoSplit=%u\n", indent_level, "", (unsigned int)ea->nosplit);
401 fprintf(f, "%*sSegmentOv=%02x\n", indent_level, "",
402 (unsigned int)x86_ea->ea.segreg);
403 fprintf(f, "%*sVSIBMode=%u\n", indent_level, "",
404 (unsigned int)x86_ea->vsib_mode);
405 fprintf(f, "%*sModRM=%03o ValidRM=%u NeedRM=%u\n", indent_level, "",
406 (unsigned int)x86_ea->modrm, (unsigned int)x86_ea->valid_modrm,
407 (unsigned int)x86_ea->need_modrm);
408 fprintf(f, "%*sSIB=%03o ValidSIB=%u NeedSIB=%u\n", indent_level, "",
409 (unsigned int)x86_ea->sib, (unsigned int)x86_ea->valid_sib,
410 (unsigned int)x86_ea->need_sib);
411}
412
413static void
414x86_common_print(const x86_common *common, FILE *f, int indent_level)
415{
416 fprintf(f, "%*sAddrSize=%u OperSize=%u LockRepPre=%02x "
417 "ACQREL_Pre=%02x BITS=%u\n",
418 indent_level, "",
419 (unsigned int)common->addrsize,
420 (unsigned int)common->opersize,
421 (unsigned int)common->lockrep_pre,
422 (unsigned int)common->acqrel_pre,
423 (unsigned int)common->mode_bits);
424}
425
426static void
427x86_opcode_print(const x86_opcode *opcode, FILE *f, int indent_level)
428{
429 fprintf(f, "%*sOpcode: %02x %02x %02x OpLen=%u\n", indent_level, "",
430 (unsigned int)opcode->opcode[0],
431 (unsigned int)opcode->opcode[1],
432 (unsigned int)opcode->opcode[2],
433 (unsigned int)opcode->len);
434}
435
436static void
437x86_bc_insn_print(const void *contents, FILE *f, int indent_level)
438{
439 const x86_insn *insn = (const x86_insn *)contents;
440
441 fprintf(f, "%*s_Instruction_\n", indent_level, "");
442 fprintf(f, "%*sEffective Address:", indent_level, "");
443 if (insn->x86_ea) {
444 fprintf(f, "\n");
445 yasm_x86__ea_print((yasm_effaddr *)insn->x86_ea, f, indent_level+1);
446 } else
447 fprintf(f, " (nil)\n");
448 fprintf(f, "%*sImmediate Value:", indent_level, "");
449 if (!insn->imm)
450 fprintf(f, " (nil)\n");
451 else {
452 indent_level++;
453 fprintf(f, "\n");
454 yasm_value_print(insn->imm, f, indent_level);
455 indent_level--;
456 }
457 x86_opcode_print(&insn->opcode, f, indent_level);
458 x86_common_print(&insn->common, f, indent_level);
459 fprintf(f, "%*sSpPre=%02x REX=%03o PostOp=%u\n", indent_level, "",
460 (unsigned int)insn->special_prefix,
461 (unsigned int)insn->rex,
462 (unsigned int)insn->postop);
463}
464
465static void
466x86_bc_jmp_print(const void *contents, FILE *f, int indent_level)
467{
468 const x86_jmp *jmp = (const x86_jmp *)contents;
469
470 fprintf(f, "%*s_Jump_\n", indent_level, "");
471 fprintf(f, "%*sTarget:\n", indent_level, "");
472 yasm_value_print(&jmp->target, f, indent_level+1);
473 /* FIXME
474 fprintf(f, "%*sOrigin=\n", indent_level, "");
475 yasm_symrec_print(jmp->origin, f, indent_level+1);
476 */
477 fprintf(f, "\n%*sShort Form:\n", indent_level, "");
478 if (jmp->shortop.len == 0)
479 fprintf(f, "%*sNone\n", indent_level+1, "");
480 else
481 x86_opcode_print(&jmp->shortop, f, indent_level+1);
482 fprintf(f, "%*sNear Form:\n", indent_level, "");
483 if (jmp->nearop.len == 0)
484 fprintf(f, "%*sNone\n", indent_level+1, "");
485 else
486 x86_opcode_print(&jmp->nearop, f, indent_level+1);
487 fprintf(f, "%*sOpSel=", indent_level, "");
488 switch (jmp->op_sel) {
489 case JMP_NONE:
490 fprintf(f, "None");
491 break;
492 case JMP_SHORT:
493 fprintf(f, "Short");
494 break;
495 case JMP_NEAR:
496 fprintf(f, "Near");
497 break;
498 case JMP_SHORT_FORCED:
499 fprintf(f, "Forced Short");
500 break;
501 case JMP_NEAR_FORCED:
502 fprintf(f, "Forced Near");
503 break;
504 default:
505 fprintf(f, "UNKNOWN!!");
506 break;
507 }
508 x86_common_print(&jmp->common, f, indent_level);
509}
510
511static void
512x86_bc_jmpfar_print(const void *contents, FILE *f, int indent_level)
513{
514 const x86_jmpfar *jmpfar = (const x86_jmpfar *)contents;
515
516 fprintf(f, "%*s_Far_Jump_\n", indent_level, "");
517 fprintf(f, "%*sSegment:\n", indent_level, "");
518 yasm_value_print(&jmpfar->segment, f, indent_level+1);
519 fprintf(f, "%*sOffset:\n", indent_level, "");
520 yasm_value_print(&jmpfar->offset, f, indent_level+1);
521 x86_opcode_print(&jmpfar->opcode, f, indent_level);
522 x86_common_print(&jmpfar->common, f, indent_level);
523}
524
525static unsigned int
526x86_common_calc_len(const x86_common *common)
527{
528 unsigned int len = 0;
529
530 if (common->addrsize != 0 && common->addrsize != common->mode_bits)
531 len++;
532 if (common->opersize != 0 &&
533 ((common->mode_bits != 64 && common->opersize != common->mode_bits) ||
534 (common->mode_bits == 64 && common->opersize == 16)))
535 len++;
536 if (common->lockrep_pre != 0)
537 len++;
538 if (common->acqrel_pre != 0)
539 len++;
540
541
542 return len;
543}
544
545static int
546x86_bc_insn_calc_len(yasm_bytecode *bc, yasm_bc_add_span_func add_span,
547 void *add_span_data)
548{
549 x86_insn *insn = (x86_insn *)bc->contents;
550 x86_effaddr *x86_ea = insn->x86_ea;
551 yasm_value *imm = insn->imm;
552
553 if (x86_ea) {
554 /* Check validity of effective address and calc R/M bits of
555 * Mod/RM byte and SIB byte. We won't know the Mod field
556 * of the Mod/RM byte until we know more about the
557 * displacement.
558 */
559 if (yasm_x86__expr_checkea(x86_ea, &insn->common.addrsize,
560 insn->common.mode_bits, insn->postop == X86_POSTOP_ADDRESS16,
561 &insn->rex, bc))
562 /* failed, don't bother checking rest of insn */
563 return -1;
564
565 if (x86_ea->ea.disp.size == 0 && x86_ea->ea.need_nonzero_len) {
566 /* Handle unknown case, default to byte-sized and set as
567 * critical expression.
568 */
569 x86_ea->ea.disp.size = 8;
570 add_span(add_span_data, bc, 1, &x86_ea->ea.disp, -128, 127);
571 }
572 bc->len += x86_ea->ea.disp.size/8;
573
574 /* Handle address16 postop case */
575 if (insn->postop == X86_POSTOP_ADDRESS16)
576 insn->common.addrsize = 0;
577
578 /* Compute length of ea and add to total */
579 bc->len += x86_ea->need_modrm + (x86_ea->need_sib ? 1:0);
580 bc->len += (x86_ea->ea.segreg != 0) ? 1 : 0;
581 }
582
583 if (imm) {
584 unsigned int immlen = imm->size;
585
586 /* TODO: check imm->len vs. sized len from expr? */
587
588 /* Handle signext_imm8 postop special-casing */
589 if (insn->postop == X86_POSTOP_SIGNEXT_IMM8) {
590 /*@null@*/ /*@only@*/ yasm_intnum *num;
591 num = yasm_value_get_intnum(imm, NULL, 0);
592
593 if (!num) {
594 /* Unknown; default to byte form and set as critical
595 * expression.
596 */
597 immlen = 8;
598 add_span(add_span_data, bc, 2, imm, -128, 127);
599 } else {
600 if (yasm_intnum_in_range(num, -128, 127)) {
601 /* We can use the sign-extended byte form: shorten
602 * the immediate length to 1 and make the byte form
603 * permanent.
604 */
605 imm->size = 8;
606 imm->sign = 1;
607 immlen = 8;
608 } else {
609 /* We can't. Copy over the word-sized opcode. */
610 insn->opcode.opcode[0] =
611 insn->opcode.opcode[insn->opcode.len];
612 insn->opcode.len = 1;
613 }
614 insn->postop = X86_POSTOP_NONE;
615 yasm_intnum_destroy(num);
616 }
617 }
618
619 bc->len += immlen/8;
620 }
621
622 /* VEX and XOP prefixes never have REX (it's embedded in the opcode).
623 * For VEX, we can come into this function with the three byte form,
624 * so we need to see if we can optimize to the two byte form.
625 * We can't do it earlier, as we don't know all of the REX byte until now.
626 */
627 if (insn->special_prefix == 0xC4) {
628 /* See if we can shorten the VEX prefix to its two byte form.
629 * In order to do this, REX.X, REX.B, and REX.W/VEX.W must all be 0,
630 * and the VEX mmmmm field must be 1.
631 */
632 if ((insn->opcode.opcode[0] & 0x1F) == 1 &&
633 (insn->opcode.opcode[1] & 0x80) == 0 &&
634 (insn->rex == 0xff || (insn->rex & 0x0B) == 0)) {
635 insn->opcode.opcode[0] = insn->opcode.opcode[1];
636 insn->opcode.opcode[1] = insn->opcode.opcode[2];
637 insn->opcode.opcode[2] = 0; /* sanity */
638 insn->opcode.len = 2;
639 insn->special_prefix = 0xC5; /* mark as two-byte VEX */
640 }
641 } else if (insn->rex != 0xff && insn->rex != 0 &&
642 insn->special_prefix != 0xC5 && insn->special_prefix != 0x8F)
643 bc->len++;
644
645 bc->len += insn->opcode.len;
646 bc->len += x86_common_calc_len(&insn->common);
647 bc->len += (insn->special_prefix != 0) ? 1:0;
648 return 0;
649}
650
651static int
652x86_bc_insn_expand(yasm_bytecode *bc, int span, long old_val, long new_val,
653 /*@out@*/ long *neg_thres, /*@out@*/ long *pos_thres)
654{
655 x86_insn *insn = (x86_insn *)bc->contents;
656 x86_effaddr *x86_ea = insn->x86_ea;
657 yasm_effaddr *ea = &x86_ea->ea;
658 yasm_value *imm = insn->imm;
659
660 if (ea && span == 1) {
661 /* Change displacement length into word-sized */
662 if (ea->disp.size == 8) {
663 ea->disp.size = (insn->common.addrsize == 16) ? 16 : 32;
664 x86_ea->modrm &= ~0300;
665 x86_ea->modrm |= 0200;
666 bc->len--;
667 bc->len += ea->disp.size/8;
668 }
669 }
670
671 if (imm && span == 2) {
672 if (insn->postop == X86_POSTOP_SIGNEXT_IMM8) {
673 /* Update bc->len for new opcode and immediate size */
674 bc->len -= insn->opcode.len;
675 bc->len += imm->size/8;
676
677 /* Change to the word-sized opcode */
678 insn->opcode.opcode[0] = insn->opcode.opcode[insn->opcode.len];
679 insn->opcode.len = 1;
680 insn->postop = X86_POSTOP_NONE;
681 }
682 }
683
684 return 0;
685}
686
687static int
688x86_bc_jmp_calc_len(yasm_bytecode *bc, yasm_bc_add_span_func add_span,
689 void *add_span_data)
690{
691 x86_jmp *jmp = (x86_jmp *)bc->contents;
692 yasm_bytecode *target_prevbc;
693 unsigned char opersize;
694
695 /* As opersize may be 0, figure out its "real" value. */
696 opersize = (jmp->common.opersize == 0) ?
697 jmp->common.mode_bits : jmp->common.opersize;
698
699 bc->len += x86_common_calc_len(&jmp->common);
700
701 if (jmp->op_sel == JMP_NEAR_FORCED || jmp->shortop.len == 0) {
702 if (jmp->nearop.len == 0) {
703 yasm_error_set(YASM_ERROR_TYPE, N_("near jump does not exist"));
704 return -1;
705 }
706
707 /* Near jump, no spans needed */
708 if (jmp->shortop.len == 0)
709 jmp->op_sel = JMP_NEAR;
710 bc->len += jmp->nearop.len;
711 bc->len += (opersize == 16) ? 2 : 4;
712 return 0;
713 }
714
715 if (jmp->op_sel == JMP_SHORT_FORCED || jmp->nearop.len == 0) {
716 if (jmp->shortop.len == 0) {
717 yasm_error_set(YASM_ERROR_TYPE, N_("short jump does not exist"));
718 return -1;
719 }
720
721 /* We want to be sure to error if we exceed short length, so
722 * put it in as a dependent expression (falling through).
723 */
724 }
725
726 if (jmp->target.rel
727 && (!yasm_symrec_get_label(jmp->target.rel, &target_prevbc)
728 || target_prevbc->section != bc->section)) {
729 /* External or out of segment, so we can't check distance.
730 * Allowing short jumps depends on the objfmt supporting
731 * 8-bit relocs. While most don't, some might, so allow it here.
732 * Otherwise default to word-sized.
733 * The objfmt will error if not supported.
734 */
735 if (jmp->op_sel == JMP_SHORT_FORCED || jmp->nearop.len == 0) {
736 if (jmp->op_sel == JMP_NONE)
737 jmp->op_sel = JMP_SHORT;
738 bc->len += jmp->shortop.len + 1;
739 } else {
740 jmp->op_sel = JMP_NEAR;
741 bc->len += jmp->nearop.len;
742 bc->len += (opersize == 16) ? 2 : 4;
743 }
744 return 0;
745 }
746
747 /* Default to short jump and generate span */
748 if (jmp->op_sel == JMP_NONE)
749 jmp->op_sel = JMP_SHORT;
750 bc->len += jmp->shortop.len + 1;
751 add_span(add_span_data, bc, 1, &jmp->target, -128+(long)bc->len,
752 127+(long)bc->len);
753 return 0;
754}
755
756static int
757x86_bc_jmp_expand(yasm_bytecode *bc, int span, long old_val, long new_val,
758 /*@out@*/ long *neg_thres, /*@out@*/ long *pos_thres)
759{
760 x86_jmp *jmp = (x86_jmp *)bc->contents;
761 unsigned char opersize;
762
763 if (span != 1)
764 yasm_internal_error(N_("unrecognized span id"));
765
766 /* As opersize may be 0, figure out its "real" value. */
767 opersize = (jmp->common.opersize == 0) ?
768 jmp->common.mode_bits : jmp->common.opersize;
769
770 if (jmp->op_sel == JMP_SHORT_FORCED || jmp->nearop.len == 0) {
771 yasm_error_set(YASM_ERROR_VALUE, N_("short jump out of range"));
772 return -1;
773 }
774
775 if (jmp->op_sel == JMP_NEAR)
776 yasm_internal_error(N_("trying to expand an already-near jump"));
777
778 /* Upgrade to a near jump */
779 jmp->op_sel = JMP_NEAR;
780 bc->len -= jmp->shortop.len + 1;
781 bc->len += jmp->nearop.len;
782 bc->len += (opersize == 16) ? 2 : 4;
783
784 return 0;
785}
786
787static int
788x86_bc_jmpfar_calc_len(yasm_bytecode *bc, yasm_bc_add_span_func add_span,
789 void *add_span_data)
790{
791 x86_jmpfar *jmpfar = (x86_jmpfar *)bc->contents;
792 unsigned char opersize;
793
794 opersize = (jmpfar->common.opersize == 0) ?
795 jmpfar->common.mode_bits : jmpfar->common.opersize;
796
797 bc->len += jmpfar->opcode.len;
798 bc->len += 2; /* segment */
799 bc->len += (opersize == 16) ? 2 : 4;
800 bc->len += x86_common_calc_len(&jmpfar->common);
801
802 return 0;
803}
804
805static void
806x86_common_tobytes(const x86_common *common, unsigned char **bufp,
807 unsigned int segreg)
808{
809 if (segreg != 0)
810 YASM_WRITE_8(*bufp, (unsigned char)segreg);
811 if (common->addrsize != 0 && common->addrsize != common->mode_bits)
812 YASM_WRITE_8(*bufp, 0x67);
813 if (common->opersize != 0 &&
814 ((common->mode_bits != 64 && common->opersize != common->mode_bits) ||
815 (common->mode_bits == 64 && common->opersize == 16)))
816 YASM_WRITE_8(*bufp, 0x66);
817 /*TSX hints come before lock prefix*/
818 if (common->acqrel_pre != 0)
819 YASM_WRITE_8(*bufp, common->acqrel_pre);
820 if (common->lockrep_pre != 0)
821 YASM_WRITE_8(*bufp, common->lockrep_pre);
822}
823
824static void
825x86_opcode_tobytes(const x86_opcode *opcode, unsigned char **bufp)
826{
827 unsigned int i;
828 for (i=0; i<opcode->len; i++)
829 YASM_WRITE_8(*bufp, opcode->opcode[i]);
830}
831
832static int
833x86_bc_insn_tobytes(yasm_bytecode *bc, unsigned char **bufp,
834 unsigned char *bufstart, void *d,
835 yasm_output_value_func output_value,
836 /*@unused@*/ yasm_output_reloc_func output_reloc)
837{
838 x86_insn *insn = (x86_insn *)bc->contents;
839 /*@null@*/ x86_effaddr *x86_ea = (x86_effaddr *)insn->x86_ea;
840 yasm_value *imm = insn->imm;
841
842 /* Prefixes */
843 x86_common_tobytes(&insn->common, bufp,
844 x86_ea ? (unsigned int)(x86_ea->ea.segreg>>8) : 0);
845 if (insn->special_prefix != 0)
846 YASM_WRITE_8(*bufp, insn->special_prefix);
847 if (insn->special_prefix == 0xC4 || insn->special_prefix == 0x8F) {
848 /* 3-byte VEX/XOP; merge in 1s complement of REX.R, REX.X, REX.B */
849 insn->opcode.opcode[0] &= 0x1F;
850 if (insn->rex != 0xff)
851 insn->opcode.opcode[0] |= ((~insn->rex) & 0x07) << 5;
852 /* merge REX.W via ORing; there should never be a case in which REX.W
853 * is important when VEX.W is already set by the instruction.
854 */
855 if (insn->rex != 0xff && (insn->rex & 0x8) != 0)
856 insn->opcode.opcode[1] |= 0x80;
857 } else if (insn->special_prefix == 0xC5) {
858 /* 2-byte VEX; merge in 1s complement of REX.R */
859 insn->opcode.opcode[0] &= 0x7F;
860 if (insn->rex != 0xff && (insn->rex & 0x4) == 0)
861 insn->opcode.opcode[0] |= 0x80;
862 /* No other REX bits should be set */
863 if (insn->rex != 0xff && (insn->rex & 0xB) != 0)
864 yasm_internal_error(N_("x86: REX.WXB set, but 2-byte VEX"));
865 } else if (insn->rex != 0xff && insn->rex != 0) {
866 if (insn->common.mode_bits != 64)
867 yasm_internal_error(N_("x86: got a REX prefix in non-64-bit mode"));
868 YASM_WRITE_8(*bufp, insn->rex);
869 }
870
871 /* Opcode */
872 x86_opcode_tobytes(&insn->opcode, bufp);
873
874 /* Effective address: ModR/M (if required), SIB (if required), and
875 * displacement (if required).
876 */
877 if (x86_ea) {
878 if (x86_ea->need_modrm) {
879 if (!x86_ea->valid_modrm)
880 yasm_internal_error(N_("invalid Mod/RM in x86 tobytes_insn"));
881 YASM_WRITE_8(*bufp, x86_ea->modrm);
882 }
883
884 if (x86_ea->need_sib) {
885 if (!x86_ea->valid_sib)
886 yasm_internal_error(N_("invalid SIB in x86 tobytes_insn"));
887 YASM_WRITE_8(*bufp, x86_ea->sib);
888 }
889
890 if (x86_ea->ea.need_disp) {
891 unsigned int disp_len = x86_ea->ea.disp.size/8;
892
893 if (x86_ea->ea.disp.ip_rel) {
894 /* Adjust relative displacement to end of bytecode */
895 /*@only@*/ yasm_intnum *delta;
896 delta = yasm_intnum_create_int(-(long)bc->len);
897 if (!x86_ea->ea.disp.abs)
898 x86_ea->ea.disp.abs =
899 yasm_expr_create_ident(yasm_expr_int(delta), bc->line);
900 else
901 x86_ea->ea.disp.abs =
902 yasm_expr_create(YASM_EXPR_ADD,
903 yasm_expr_expr(x86_ea->ea.disp.abs),
904 yasm_expr_int(delta), bc->line);
905 }
906 if (output_value(&x86_ea->ea.disp, *bufp, disp_len,
907 (unsigned long)(*bufp-bufstart), bc, 1, d))
908 return 1;
909 *bufp += disp_len;
910 }
911 }
912
913 /* Immediate (if required) */
914 if (imm) {
915 unsigned int imm_len;
916 if (insn->postop == X86_POSTOP_SIGNEXT_IMM8) {
917 /* If we got here with this postop still set, we need to force
918 * imm size to 8 here.
919 */
920 imm->size = 8;
921 imm->sign = 1;
922 imm_len = 1;
923 } else
924 imm_len = imm->size/8;
925 if (output_value(imm, *bufp, imm_len, (unsigned long)(*bufp-bufstart),
926 bc, 1, d))
927 return 1;
928 *bufp += imm_len;
929 }
930
931 return 0;
932}
933
934static int
935x86_bc_jmp_tobytes(yasm_bytecode *bc, unsigned char **bufp,
936 unsigned char *bufstart, void *d,
937 yasm_output_value_func output_value,
938 /*@unused@*/ yasm_output_reloc_func output_reloc)
939{
940 x86_jmp *jmp = (x86_jmp *)bc->contents;
941 unsigned char opersize;
942 unsigned int i;
943 /*@only@*/ yasm_intnum *delta;
944
945 /* Prefixes */
946 x86_common_tobytes(&jmp->common, bufp, 0);
947
948 /* As opersize may be 0, figure out its "real" value. */
949 opersize = (jmp->common.opersize == 0) ?
950 jmp->common.mode_bits : jmp->common.opersize;
951
952 /* Check here again to see if forms are actually legal. */
953 switch (jmp->op_sel) {
954 case JMP_SHORT_FORCED:
955 case JMP_SHORT:
956 /* 1 byte relative displacement */
957 if (jmp->shortop.len == 0)
958 yasm_internal_error(N_("short jump does not exist"));
959
960 /* Opcode */
961 x86_opcode_tobytes(&jmp->shortop, bufp);
962
963 /* Adjust relative displacement to end of bytecode */
964 delta = yasm_intnum_create_int(-(long)bc->len);
965 if (!jmp->target.abs)
966 jmp->target.abs = yasm_expr_create_ident(yasm_expr_int(delta),
967 bc->line);
968 else
969 jmp->target.abs =
970 yasm_expr_create(YASM_EXPR_ADD,
971 yasm_expr_expr(jmp->target.abs),
972 yasm_expr_int(delta), bc->line);
973
974 jmp->target.size = 8;
975 jmp->target.sign = 1;
976 if (output_value(&jmp->target, *bufp, 1,
977 (unsigned long)(*bufp-bufstart), bc, 1, d))
978 return 1;
979 *bufp += 1;
980 break;
981 case JMP_NEAR_FORCED:
982 case JMP_NEAR:
983 /* 2/4 byte relative displacement (depending on operand size) */
984 if (jmp->nearop.len == 0) {
985 yasm_error_set(YASM_ERROR_TYPE,
986 N_("near jump does not exist"));
987 return 1;
988 }
989
990 /* Opcode */
991 x86_opcode_tobytes(&jmp->nearop, bufp);
992
993 i = (opersize == 16) ? 2 : 4;
994
995 /* Adjust relative displacement to end of bytecode */
996 delta = yasm_intnum_create_int(-(long)bc->len);
997 if (!jmp->target.abs)
998 jmp->target.abs = yasm_expr_create_ident(yasm_expr_int(delta),
999 bc->line);
1000 else
1001 jmp->target.abs =
1002 yasm_expr_create(YASM_EXPR_ADD,
1003 yasm_expr_expr(jmp->target.abs),
1004 yasm_expr_int(delta), bc->line);
1005
1006 jmp->target.size = i*8;
1007 jmp->target.sign = 1;
1008 if (output_value(&jmp->target, *bufp, i,
1009 (unsigned long)(*bufp-bufstart), bc, 1, d))
1010 return 1;
1011 *bufp += i;
1012 break;
1013 case JMP_NONE:
1014 yasm_internal_error(N_("jump op_sel cannot be JMP_NONE in tobytes"));
1015 default:
1016 yasm_internal_error(N_("unrecognized relative jump op_sel"));
1017 }
1018 return 0;
1019}
1020
1021static int
1022x86_bc_jmpfar_tobytes(yasm_bytecode *bc, unsigned char **bufp,
1023 unsigned char *bufstart, void *d,
1024 yasm_output_value_func output_value,
1025 /*@unused@*/ yasm_output_reloc_func output_reloc)
1026{
1027 x86_jmpfar *jmpfar = (x86_jmpfar *)bc->contents;
1028 unsigned int i;
1029 unsigned char opersize;
1030
1031 x86_common_tobytes(&jmpfar->common, bufp, 0);
1032 x86_opcode_tobytes(&jmpfar->opcode, bufp);
1033
1034 /* As opersize may be 0, figure out its "real" value. */
1035 opersize = (jmpfar->common.opersize == 0) ?
1036 jmpfar->common.mode_bits : jmpfar->common.opersize;
1037
1038 /* Absolute displacement: segment and offset */
1039 i = (opersize == 16) ? 2 : 4;
1040 jmpfar->offset.size = i*8;
1041 if (output_value(&jmpfar->offset, *bufp, i,
1042 (unsigned long)(*bufp-bufstart), bc, 1, d))
1043 return 1;
1044 *bufp += i;
1045 jmpfar->segment.size = 16;
1046 if (output_value(&jmpfar->segment, *bufp, 2,
1047 (unsigned long)(*bufp-bufstart), bc, 1, d))
1048 return 1;
1049 *bufp += 2;
1050
1051 return 0;
1052}
1053
1054int
1055yasm_x86__intnum_tobytes(yasm_arch *arch, const yasm_intnum *intn,
1056 unsigned char *buf, size_t destsize, size_t valsize,
1057 int shift, const yasm_bytecode *bc, int warn)
1058{
1059 /* Write value out. */
1060 yasm_intnum_get_sized(intn, buf, destsize, valsize, shift, 0, warn);
1061 return 0;
1062}
